I also have the T60 with dual, but only Windoze there so far. But don't blame it on Ubuntu, it's the Xorg thing. it's ingrained in Linux (and all unices). Hopefully GNOME or KDE would take over it's low-level functions and come up with a better thing.
i see...are there any plans on that?
but that's years away in the best case.
hmm damn
is it a big module?
what's more, you can blame most of your system crashes on graphics-engine related issues.
hmm when was xorg created?
it's not a module. See it like an onion: on the center is the kernel, then the shell, then the graphics engine, then the desktop systems (GNOME, KDE, XFCE, etc.) and then the applications. Sort of.
ohhh i kinda thought that all nix system was as opposed to windows systems module based
Windoze is also layer-based. On the center is DOS and its components and then the graphical interface. I suppose this is a common paradigm of operating systems design.
so xorg is the weak point of linux?
